# elizaOS Discord - 2025-11-06

## Overall Discussion Highlights

### Token Migration
- The migration from AI16Z tokens to ElizaOS tokens was scheduled to begin but experienced delays
- Several exchanges (MEXC, Binance Alpha, Gate, and Bybit) are supporting the migration with different timelines
- MEXC appears to be the first exchange to complete the swap for users
- The migration process involves minimal gas fees and will remain open for 90 days
- Tokens will be immediately tradeable after migration
- Community members repeatedly asked about migration procedures for self-custody wallets

### Development Updates
- Shaw submitted and R0am merged PR #5 to the otc-agent repository
- Development of a "login with cloud" SDK is underway to enable seamless authentication across multiple applications
- Plans to add an "Apps" section to Cloud where users can whitelist domains and link external apps
- Discussion about plugin-sql dependencies and requests to release the plugin-elizacloud plugin
- Sentry errors were dismissed as a non-issue from a single user

### Community & Promotion
- Coordination for promotional activities including a town hall featuring "Eliza agents"
- Plans to stream promotion for an OpenSea collection called "Art Decc0s"
- Discussion about Discord bot integration with ElizaOS
- Suggestions to improve project communication strategy and marketing

## Key Questions & Answers

### Token Migration
- **Q**: How do I swap AI16Z tokens for ElizaOS on exchanges?  
  **A**: Different exchanges have their own processes; check exchange announcements

- **Q**: Is there a decentralized migration option for self-custody tokens?  
  **A**: Yes, through the migration portal that will be announced

- **Q**: Will Bybit support the migration?  
  **A**: Yes, Bybit supports migration for spot trading

- **Q**: Do we need gas fee for migration?  
  **A**: Yes, but very little

- **Q**: Does the migration support Phantom wallet?  
  **A**: Yes, Phantom will be supported

- **Q**: When will trading start for the new token?  
  **A**: Depends on the exchange; Binance should be trading 7 hours after migration

- **Q**: Will the value of tokens change after migration?  
  **A**: The value of your tokens shouldn't change

- **Q**: How long is the migration window open?  
  **A**: Window is open for 90 days

- **Q**: Will migrated tokens be tradeable right away?  
  **A**: Yes, that's right

### Development
- **Q**: Can we release the plugin-elizacloud plugin?  
  **A**: Yes, just bump the package.json version to publish it

- **Q**: Is there a problem with Sentry errors?  
  **A**: No, it's just one user spamming a CORS error from a weird browser, elizaos works fine

- **Q**: How should I deploy a Discord bot?  
  **A**: Use plugin-discord, and visit discord.com/developers/ for setting up keys

## Community Help & Collaboration

- **Toni helped AlexZ** with correct information about Bybit supporting the migration, providing a link to Bybit's announcement
- **Burn helped Mario** by explaining that Phantom wallet would be supported, gas fees would be minimal, and the migration window would be open for 90 days
- **MDMnvest helped Muslim_Man** by explaining they need to wait for the migration portal and stay tuned to announcements
- **Figure helped KarshalQ** by directing them to the migration help channel
- **Odilitime helped Figure** with Discord bot deployment, suggesting plugin-discord and directing to discord.com/developers for setting up keys
- **Shaw helped R0am** by creating PR #5 with fixes for the otc-agent repository, which R0am merged
- **cjft helped 0xbbjoker** by advising how to release plugin-elizacloud by bumping the package.json version

## Action Items

### Technical
- Implement migration portal for self-custody wallets (Mentioned by: cjft)
- Deploy liquidity pools for ElizaOS (Mentioned by: cjft, Burn)
- Create Discord bot integration with ElizaOS (Mentioned by: Figure)
- Deploy Discord bot using plugin-discord and configure keys (Mentioned by: Figure)
- Deploy Eliza on AWS (Mentioned by: Wes)
- Implement "login with cloud" SDK for cross-app authentication (Mentioned by: cjft)
- Release plugin-elizacloud plugin (Mentioned by: 0xbbjoker)
- Fix plugin-sql dependency issues (Mentioned by: 0xbbjoker)

### Documentation
- Provide clear migration instructions for different wallets (Mentioned by: Mario, Muslim_Man)
- Create resource explaining team structure and roles (Mentioned by: Broccolex, AlexZ)
- Develop non-technical explanation of token value accrual (Mentioned by: Broccolex)
- Create or share documentation about recent migration (Mentioned by: KarshalQ)
- Create new Docs site for Cloud (Mentioned by: cjft)

### Feature
- Improve project communication strategy (Mentioned by: Broccolex)
- Expand social media presence (Mentioned by: Broccolex, AlexZ)
- Add Telegram channels including Russian language support (Mentioned by: AlexZ)
- Coordinate streaming to promote Art Decc0s OpenSea collection (Mentioned by: Reneil)
- Add "Apps" section to Cloud for domain whitelisting and external app linking (Mentioned by: cjft)

# elizaOS Discord - 2025-11-05

## Overall Discussion Highlights

### Token Migration (November 7th)
- The AI16z to ElizaOS token migration is scheduled for November 7th
- A migration portal will be available for non-custodial wallet holders
- Multiple exchanges confirmed to support the migration including MEXC, Bitget, Crypto.com, and Gate.io
- Some users expressed concerns about futures positions on exchanges that are delisting AI16z
- Market volatility was briefly discussed (40% up followed by 20% down)

### Technical Development
- Core release version 1.6.4 was announced
- Security concern identified with the `api/system/env/local` endpoint being accessible in development mode
- Bug reported requiring a temporary workaround in the eliza-cloud-v2 repository
- Issues with the otc-agent and plugin-thedesk module were discussed and resolved
- Brief mention of "10k elizaOS agents live" with a link to a Museum of Crypto Art project

### Tools & Resources
- Discussion about ampcode.com as a potential alternative to Claude Code
- Reneil shared information about a stream featuring "10 moca agents"
- Some hypothetical discussion about autonomous agents that could persist over time
- Interest expressed in infrastructure that would allow agents to maintain memories and assist with tasks over decades

## Key Questions & Answers

**Q: Do we go to a portal after November 7th to convert to ElizaOS on chain?**  
A: Yes exactly. We'll introduce the portal URL from our official channels, so keep an eye on our Mirror. (answered by Kenk)

**Q: Anyone know if MEXC is doing the migration?**  
A: Yes they are supporting the migration. See labs-announcements (answered by MDMnvest)

**Q: I am holding Ai16z on Bitget what should I do now?**  
A: Bitget is supporting migration (answered by Toni)

**Q: I have all my assets on crypto.com, do they support migration?**  
A: Yeah, they're supporting it https://x.com/cryptocom/status/1985574934827921867?s=46&t=vpkLs81PC2m1VztJvg9fzA (answered by Toni)

**Q: Is it possible to migrate through solflare to ElizaOS?**  
A: Yes, there is going to be migration portal starting November 7th for Non custodial wallets. Follow <#1299473809166045357> (answered by Toni)

**Q: Why am I getting "Module not found: Can't resolve './plugin-thedesk'" error?**  
A: Stan provided GitHub links to the correct file location and a PR (answered by Stan ⚡)

**Q: Has anyone tried ampcode.com as an alternative to Claude Code?**  
A: Yes (answered by sayonara)

## Community Help & Collaboration

1. **Token Migration Support**
   - Toni helped multiple users (Markhor, mrkevin, Taco) with migration questions, providing confirmation about exchange support and linking to official announcements
   - MDMnvest assisted several users (mike.garf, zkSam, Shaa07dy, Man Demm) by directing them to the comprehensive list of supporting exchanges and providing migration guidance
   - Kenk provided clear information about the upcoming migration portal

2. **Technical Troubleshooting**
   - Stan ⚡ helped R0am resolve an issue with the plugin-thedesk module in otc-agent by providing GitHub links to the correct file and a PR to fix the issue
   - 0xbbjoker shared a PR (#6134) and temporary workaround for a bug in the eliza-cloud-v2 repository

## Action Items

### Technical
- Create PR to disable api/system/env/local by default in dev mode for security (Mentioned by Odilitime)
- Merge PR for fixing plugin-thedesk import in otc-agent (Mentioned by Stan ⚡)
- Fix bug reported in PR #6134 (Mentioned by 0xbbjoker)
- Investigate if client breaks in production mode (Mentioned by Odilitime)
- Launch migration portal for non-custodial wallets on November 7th (Mentioned by Kenk)
- Address futures positions on delisting exchanges (Mentioned by Da Michl)
- Handle account issue (Mentioned by shaw)

### Documentation
- Maintain and update list of exchanges supporting migration (Mentioned by MDMnvest)
- Provide clear instructions for using the migration portal for non-custodial wallet holders (Mentioned by Toni)

### Feature
- Consider getting Eliza listed on Grayscale's assets under consideration (Mentioned by DorianD)

# elizaOS Discord - 2025-11-04

## Overall Discussion Highlights

### Token Migration
- AI16Z tokens will migrate to ElizaOS tokens on November 7th with a 1:6 conversion ratio (1 AI16Z = 6 ElizaOS)
- Users will have a 90-day window to complete manual migrations
- Exchanges will handle automatic migrations for users who don't hold their own keys
- Official information about which exchanges support automatic migration will be shared on Friday
- Some users debating whether to buy more AI16Z before migration or wait
- Lighter (perps dex) will not support AI16Z after migration; listing ElizaOS is at their discretion

### Technical Discussions
- Debate about storing x402 payment configurations in project initialization vs. character files
- Characters can have personal wallets with configurations in character files
- Environment variables can set defaults that character secrets can override
- Brief mentions of Elysia as a potential rewrite target
- Discussion about Puppeteer/Playwright for headless hardware-accelerated video encoding and streaming in containers
- Suggestion to use Nia with MCP to index documentation for hybrid search capabilities

### Ecosystem & Events
- Moca launching 10k Eliza agents (mentioned by Reneil)
- AI events on Luma.com discussed as potential opportunities for user onboarding and investor presentations
- Concerns raised about high APY (35%) on USDC in a related protocol, with warnings about systemic risk exposure to XUSD
- Some users reported issues with ElizaOS mirror.xyz sites not working properly

## Key Questions & Answers

**Q: Can someone explain what will happen to the coins on November 7th?**  
A: 1 token AI16Z equals 6 tokens ElizaOS, with a 90-day migration window.

**Q: Which wallets or exchanges will do the migration automatically?**  
A: Basically anything not an exchange you'll have to migrate manually. If you don't own the keys it'll be automatic.

**Q: Will there be a snapshot?**  
A: No snapshot. You'll have 90 days to migrate your AI16Z.

**Q: Why is there a high APY on USDC? 35% is really huge.**  
A: Because they are exposed to systemic risk with XUSD... avoid it as funds may become trapped.

**Q: x402 payment configs in project init (with runtime::registerPaymentConfig) OR in character file?**  
A: If characters can have personal wallets, then configurations can go directly into the character for 402x.

**Q: Do characters currently own personal wallets or is it agent/server wide?**  
A: You can use ENV vars to set defaults but can override in character secrets, enabling wallets per agent.

## Community Help & Collaboration

1. **Token Migration Clarification**
   - Helper: moclov8
   - Helpee: Mohammed S. Abdulmoneem
   - Context: Confusion about which exchanges will handle the token migration automatically
   - Resolution: Explained that exchanges holding user tokens will handle migration automatically, while self-custody wallets require manual migration

2. **Exchange Delisting Clarification**
   - Helper: Kenk
   - Helpee: TOM
   - Context: Confusion about Lighter delisting AI16Z
   - Resolution: Clarified that Lighter is a perps dex so AI16Z won't be tradable there after migration, and listing ElizaOS is up to them

3. **Website Functionality Check**
   - Helper: Odilitime
   - Helpee: cavey65
   - Context: User claimed ElizaOS mirror.xyz sites don't work
   - Resolution: Confirmed that mirror.xyz/elizaos.eth works fine

4. **Puppeteer/Playwright Guidance**
   - Helper: LarpsAI
   - Helpee: jin
   - Context: Seeking Puppeteer/Playwright expertise
   - Resolution: Suggested using Nia with MCP to index documentation and repositories, plus using reference tools for web search synthesis

5. **Discord Channel Visibility Issue**
   - Helper: sam-developer & Odilitime
   - Helpee: Borko
   - Context: Missing cloud channel in Discord client
   - Resolution: Confirmed channel was visible and suggested checking if channel was unselected in client settings

## Action Items

### Technical
- Implement migration of AI16Z tokens to ElizaOS tokens on November 7th with 1:6 conversion ratio and 90-day migration window (Mentioned by multiple users)
- Implement headless hardware accelerated video encoding/streaming from inside containers using Puppeteer/Playwright (Mentioned by jin)
- Evaluate Clank Tank for scoring student capstone projects in dev-cursor-UI bootcamp (Mentioned by Rabbidfly)
- Consider implementing x402 payment configurations in character files (Mentioned by Odilitime, Stan ⚡, Borko)
- Evaluate Elysia as potential rewrite target (Mentioned by cjft)
- Address concerns about high APY USDC exposure to XUSD (Mentioned by orion)

### Documentation
- Create list of exchanges supporting automatic migration (Mentioned by Kenk)
- Fix non-working ElizaOS mirror.xyz sites (Mentioned by cavey65)
- Document wallet configuration options for ENV vars vs character secrets (Mentioned by Odilitime)

### Feature
- Launch of 10k Eliza agents (Mentioned by Reneil)
- Consider engaging with AI events on platforms like Luma.com to onboard users (Mentioned by DorianD)
- Explore creating a dark pool version of HyperLiquid chain for privacy (Mentioned by DorianD)

# elizaOS Discord - 2025-11-06

## Overall Discussion Highlights

### Token Migration
- The migration from AI16Z tokens to ElizaOS tokens was scheduled to begin but experienced delays
- Several exchanges (MEXC, Binance Alpha, Gate, and Bybit) are supporting the migration with different timelines
- MEXC appears to be the first exchange to complete the swap for users
- The migration process involves minimal gas fees and will remain open for 90 days
- Tokens will be immediately tradeable after migration
- Community members repeatedly asked about migration procedures for self-custody wallets

### Development Updates
- Shaw submitted and R0am merged PR #5 to the otc-agent repository
- Development of a "login with cloud" SDK is underway to enable seamless authentication across multiple applications
- Plans to add an "Apps" section to Cloud where users can whitelist domains and link external apps
- Discussion about plugin-sql dependencies and requests to release the plugin-elizacloud plugin
- Sentry errors were dismissed as a non-issue from a single user

### Community & Promotion
- Coordination for promotional activities including a town hall featuring "Eliza agents"
- Plans to stream promotion for an OpenSea collection called "Art Decc0s"
- Discussion about Discord bot integration with ElizaOS
- Suggestions to improve project communication strategy and marketing

## Key Questions & Answers

### Token Migration
- **Q**: How do I swap AI16Z tokens for ElizaOS on exchanges?  
  **A**: Different exchanges have their own processes; check exchange announcements

- **Q**: Is there a decentralized migration option for self-custody tokens?  
  **A**: Yes, through the migration portal that will be announced

- **Q**: Will Bybit support the migration?  
  **A**: Yes, Bybit supports migration for spot trading

- **Q**: Do we need gas fee for migration?  
  **A**: Yes, but very little

- **Q**: Does the migration support Phantom wallet?  
  **A**: Yes, Phantom will be supported

- **Q**: When will trading start for the new token?  
  **A**: Depends on the exchange; Binance should be trading 7 hours after migration

- **Q**: Will the value of tokens change after migration?  
  **A**: The value of your tokens shouldn't change

- **Q**: How long is the migration window open?  
  **A**: Window is open for 90 days

- **Q**: Will migrated tokens be tradeable right away?  
  **A**: Yes, that's right

### Development
- **Q**: Can we release the plugin-elizacloud plugin?  
  **A**: Yes, just bump the package.json version to publish it

- **Q**: Is there a problem with Sentry errors?  
  **A**: No, it's just one user spamming a CORS error from a weird browser, elizaos works fine

- **Q**: How should I deploy a Discord bot?  
  **A**: Use plugin-discord, and visit discord.com/developers/ for setting up keys

## Community Help & Collaboration

- **Toni helped AlexZ** with correct information about Bybit supporting the migration, providing a link to Bybit's announcement
- **Burn helped Mario** by explaining that Phantom wallet would be supported, gas fees would be minimal, and the migration window would be open for 90 days
- **MDMnvest helped Muslim_Man** by explaining they need to wait for the migration portal and stay tuned to announcements
- **Figure helped KarshalQ** by directing them to the migration help channel

- **Shaw helped R0am** by creating PR #5 with fixes for the otc-agent repository, which R0am merged
- **cjft helped 0xbbjoker** by advising how to release plugin-elizacloud by bumping the package.json version

# elizaos/eliza Weekly Report (Nov 2 - 8, 2025)

## 🚀 Highlights
This week's activity focused on initiating new features and planning for future enhancements. Development began on core security and runtime improvements, with new pull requests opened to implement entity-level row-level security and to add an ElizaOS reference to the runtime. Concurrently, several new issues were created to guide future work, focusing on core performance through parallel actions and background tasks, as well as user engagement with a points and leaderboard system. The period was characterized by laying the groundwork for upcoming features rather than completing existing ones.

## 🛠️ Key Developments
While no major features were completed this period, work was initiated on two key fronts through new pull requests:

-   **Security Framework:** A new pull request, [#6107](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6107), was opened to begin the implementation of entity-level row-level security (RLS). This work is complemented by a new issue, [#6112](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6112), opened for discussion on the same topic.
-   **Runtime Enhancements:** To improve the runtime environment, work was started in [#6111](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6111) to add an ElizaOS reference, a foundational step for future runtime capabilities.

## 🐛 Issues & Triage
No issues were closed this week. The focus was on opening new discussions to shape the project's direction.

-   **New & Active Issues:** Four significant new issues were opened, outlining key areas for future development:
    -   **Core Functionality & Performance:** Discussions were started around improving the system's operational capabilities with proposals for "Parallel actions" ([#6108](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6108)) and "Background tasks" ([#6109](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6109)).
    -   **User Engagement & Security:** Future enhancements were proposed for user interaction via a "Points / Leaderboard" system ([#6110](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6110)) and for data security with "Entity-level RLS" ([#6112](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6112)).

## 💬 Community & Collaboration
The provided reports indicate a focus on initiating new work streams through the opening of pull requests and issues. There were no specific details in the reports regarding high-volume discussions or collaborative reviews during this period.

# elizaos/eliza Monthly Report (November 2025)

## 🚀 Highlights
November kicked off with a dual focus on enhancing system stability and laying the groundwork for significant new capabilities. A critical bug affecting agent settings persistence was resolved, directly improving the framework's reliability. Concurrently, new development was initiated to introduce entity-level security and enhance the core runtime. The opening of several strategic issues signals a forward-looking push towards improved performance through parallel actions and background tasks, as well as new user engagement features.

## 🛠️ Key Developments
Work this month balanced immediate fixes with the introduction of new features.

- **Agent Stability Improvement**
  A significant bug was fixed that prevented agent settings from persisting across restarts, ensuring that runtime-generated configurations are now correctly retained. This change, made to the core runtime initialization logic, enhances the overall reliability of agent operations ([#6106](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6106)).

- **New Feature Initiatives**
  Development began on several new fronts with the opening of new pull requests:
  - **Security:** A proposal was made to implement entity-level row-level security, aiming to add more granular data access controls ([#6107](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6107)).
  - **Runtime Enhancements:** Work started on adding an ElizaOS reference directly to the runtime, likely to streamline framework interactions ([#6111](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6111)).

## 🐛 Issues & Triage
Issue tracking this month was focused on defining the next wave of development priorities.

- **Closed Issues:** No issues were closed during this period.

- **New & Active Issues:** Several key issues were opened, outlining major areas for future work:
  - **Core Functionality & Performance:** Discussions were initiated around implementing "Parallel actions" ([#6108](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6108)) and "Background tasks" ([#6109](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6109)), indicating a focus on scaling the system's operational capacity.
  - **Security & User Engagement:** New issues were created for "Entity-level RLS" ([#6112](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6112)), which complements the ongoing PR, and a "Points / Leaderboard" system ([#6110](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6110)) to enhance user interaction.
  - According to the reports, none of the active issues have generated more than three comments, suggesting discussions are still in their early stages.

## 💬 Community & Collaboration
The provided reports indicate a period of focused, heads-down development. While new pull requests and issues were opened, the data does not show any high-volume discussions or specific collaborative events. The alignment between the new pull request for RLS ([#6107](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6107)) and the corresponding new issue ([#6112](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6112)) suggests coordinated planning around new features.

      "title": "fix: entity names array serialization for PostgreSQL",

      "number": 6133,
      "body": "Fix entity creation failures by normalizing the names field to ensure it's\r\nalways a proper array before database operations. Handles Set objects by\r\nconverting them with Array.from().\r\n\r\n- Add normalization in createEntities() and updateEntity()\r\n- Add test suite with 9 comprehensive tests\r\n- All 491 plugin-sql tests pass\n\n<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->\n---\n\n> [!NOTE]\n> Normalizes `Entity.names` to a proper string array in create/update operations and adds extensive integration tests covering diverse input types.\n> \n> - **Backend (plugin-sql)**:\n>   - Add `private normalizeEntityNames()` in `src/base.ts` to coerce `Entity.names` into a string array (handles strings, arrays, Sets, Maps/iterables, non-iterables, null/undefined; stringifies elements).\n>   - Apply normalization and default `metadata: {}` in `createEntities()` and `updateEntity()`.\n>   - Enhance error logging in `createEntities()` with stack trace on failure.\n> - **Tests**:\n>   - Add `__tests__/integration/entity-array-fix.test.ts` covering creation/update with single/multiple/empty names, Sets, batch insert, special/unicode chars.\n>   - Expand `__tests__/integration/entity-methods.test.ts` with normalization scenarios: string (no char-splitting), Set, Map, custom iterables, numbers/booleans/objects/null/undefined, mixed-type arrays/Sets, and update paths.\n> \n> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit 749e83062f833482b41c2b5c2399bdc968b03a70.       "id": "PR_kwDOMT5cIs6xVNKQ",
      "title": "feat: Framework for adjusting prompts to best fix model contexts",
      "author": "odilitime",
      "number": 6113,
      "body": "# Risks\r\n\r\nLow, new feature, uses some memory but I put configurable limit on it\r\n\r\n# Background\r\n\r\n## What does this PR do?\r\n\r\nIt add a dynamic prompt execution system\r\n\r\n## What kind of change is this?\r\n\r\nFeatures (non-breaking change which adds functionality)\r\n\r\n## Why are we doing this? Any context or related work?\r\n\r\nPeople may use models with lower context and get hallucination, this helps detect when the context is blown out.\r\n\r\n# Documentation changes needed?\r\n\r\nMy changes require a change to the project documentation.\n\n<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->\n---\n\n> [!NOTE]\n> Introduces a schema-based dynamic prompt executor with validation/retries/metrics and replaces ad-hoc prompting in message flows, plus supporting types/utils and test updates.\n> \n> - **Core Runtime**:\n>   - Add `runtime.dynamicPromptExecFromState(...)` for schema-driven prompt execution (XML/JSON parsing, UUID validation codes, retries, Handlebars state injection, token estimations).\n>   - Track execution metrics via `modelSchemaMetrics` and `modelMetrics` with optional LRU eviction (`DYNAMIC_PROMPT_MAX_ENTRIES`) and retry policy (`VALIDATION_LEVEL`).\n>   - Expose metrics getters/clearers; helper methods for cache/keys; minor logging adjustments.\n> - **Message Service**:\n>   - Replace manual `useModel` + XML parsing with `dynamicPromptExecFromState` in:\n>     - `shouldRespond` evaluation (small model).\n>     - Single-shot handler (requires `thought`, `actions`).\n>     - Multi-step decision loop and final summary.\n>   - Improve error logging and minor flow tweaks.\n> - **Types/Utils**:\n>   - Export `SchemaRow` and `State` from `types`; extend `IAgentRuntime` with `dynamicPromptExecFromState`.\n>   - Export `upgradeDoubleToTriple` and `composeRandomUser` from `utils`.\n> - **Tests/Test Utils**:\n>   - Update `message-service` tests to mock `dynamicPromptExecFromState` responses.\n>   - Add mock implementation in test runtime; minor logger formatting changes.\n> \n> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit 5905b5f9ab86dd7b7d727d92060575f42a8fc707. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>\n<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->",
